title: Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageClient
name: StorageClient
description: Google Cloud Storage allows you to store and retrieve data on Google's infrastructure. Find more information at the Google Cloud Storage API docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: config.apiEndpoint
params.description: The hostname with optional port to use in place of the default service endpoint. Example: foobar.com or foobar.com:1234.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache used storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.credentialsFetcher
params.description: A credentials fetcher instance.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.requestTimeout
params.description: Seconds to wait before timing out the request. Defaults to 0 with REST and 60 with gRPC.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.quotaProject
params.description: Specifies a user project to bill for access charges associated with the request.

methods.name: bucket
methods.description:
Lazily instantiates a bucket. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a bucket please see Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket.

If $userProject is set to true, the current project ID (used to instantiate the client) will be billed for all requests. If $userProject is a project ID, given as a string, that project will be billed for all requests. This only has an effect when the bucket is not owned by the current or given project ID.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the bucket to request.

params.name: userProject
params.description: If true, the current Project ID will be used. If a string, that string will be used as the userProject argument, and that project will be billed for the request. Defaults to false.

examples.caption: Get all buckets beginning with the prefix 'album'.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per requested page.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: options.prefix
params.description: Filter results with this prefix.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either 'full' or 'noAcl'.

params.name: options.fields
params.description: Selector which will cause the response to only return the specified fields.

params.name: options.userProject
params.description: If set, this is the ID of the project which will be billed for the request.

params.name: options.bucketUserProject
params.description: If true, each returned instance will have $userProject set to the value of $options.userProject. If false, $options.userProject will be used ONLY for the listBuckets operation. If $options.userProject is not set, this option has no effect. Defaults to true.

exceptions.description: When a project ID has not been detected.

methods.name: createBucket
methods.description: Create a bucket. Bucket names must be unique as Cloud Storage uses a flat namespace. For more information please see bucket name requirements

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the bucket to be created.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the bucket. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.predefinedDefaultObjectAcl
params.description: Apply a predefined set of default object access controls to this bucket.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl". Defaults to "noAcl", unless the bucket resource specifies acl or defaultObjectAcl properties, when it defaults to "full".

params.name: options.fields
params.description: Selector which will cause the response to only return the specified fields.

params.name: options.acl
params.description: Access controls on the bucket.

params.name: options.cors
params.description: The bucket's Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) configuration.

params.name: options.defaultObjectAcl
params.description: Default access controls to apply to new objects when no ACL is provided.

params.name: options.lifecycle
params.description: The bucket's lifecycle configuration.

params.name: options.location
params.description: The location of the bucket. If specifying a dual-region, the customPlacementConfig property should be set in conjunction. For more information, see Bucket Locations. Defaults to "US".

params.name: options.customPlacementConfig
params.description: The bucket's dual regions. For more information, see Bucket Locations.

params.name: options.logging
params.description: The bucket's logging configuration, which defines the destination bucket and optional name prefix for the current bucket's logs.

params.name: options.storageClass
params.description: The bucket's storage class. This defines how objects in the bucket are stored and determines the SLA and the cost of storage. Acceptable values include the following strings: "STANDARD", "NEARLINE", "COLDLINE" and "ARCHIVE". Legacy values including "MULTI_REGIONAL", "REGIONAL" and "DURABLE_REDUCED_AVAILABILITY" are also available, but should be avoided for new implementations. For more information, refer to the Storage Classes documentation. Defaults to "STANDARD".

params.name: options.versioning
params.description: The bucket's versioning configuration.

params.name: options.website
params.description: The bucket's website configuration.

params.name: options.billing
params.description: The bucket's billing configuration.

params.name: options.billing.requesterPays
params.description: When true, requests to this bucket and objects within it must provide a project ID to which the request will be billed.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: The Bucket labels. Labels are represented as an array of keys and values. To remove an existing label, set its value to null.

params.name: options.userProject
params.description: If set, this is the ID of the project which will be billed for the request.

params.name: options.bucketUserProject
params.description: If true, the returned instance will have $userProject set to the value of $options.userProject. If false, $options.userProject will be used ONLY for the createBucket operation. If $options.userProject is not set, this option has no effect. Defaults to true.

params.name: options.encryption
params.description: Encryption configuration used by default for newly inserted objects.

params.name: options.encryption.defaultKmsKeyName
params.description: A Cloud KMS Key used to encrypt objects uploaded into this bucket. Should be in the format projects/my-project/locations/kr-location/keyRings/my-kr/cryptoKeys/my-key. Please note the KMS key ring must use the same location as the bucket.

params.name: options.defaultEventBasedHold
params.description: When true, newly created objects in this bucket will be retained indefinitely until an event occurs, signified by the hold's release.

params.name: options.retentionPolicy
params.description: Defines the retention policy for a bucket. In order to lock a retention policy, please see Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket::lockRetentionPolicy().

params.name: options.retentionPolicy.retentionPeriod
params.description: Specifies the retention period for objects in seconds. During the retention period an object cannot be overwritten or deleted. Retention period must be greater than zero and less than 100 years.

params.name: options.iamConfiguration
params.description: The bucket's IAM configuration.

params.name: options.iamConfiguration.bucketPolicyOnly.enabled
params.description: this is an alias for $iamConfiguration.uniformBucketLevelAccess.

params.name: options.iamConfiguration.uniformBucketLevelAccess.enabled
params.description: If set and true, access checks only use bucket-level IAM policies or above. When enabled, requests attempting to view or manipulate ACLs will fail with error code 400. NOTE: Before using Uniform bucket-level access, please review the feature documentation, as well as Should You Use uniform bucket-level access

params.name: options.rpo
params.description: Specifies the Turbo Replication setting for a dual-region bucket. The possible values are DEFAULT and ASYNC_TURBO. Trying to set the rpo for a non dual-region bucket will throw an exception. Non existence of this parameter is equivalent to it being DEFAULT.

exceptions.description: When a project ID has not been detected.

methods.name: registerStreamWrapper
methods.description: Registers this StorageClient as the handler for stream reading/writing.

params.name: protocol
params.description: The name of the protocol to use. Defaults to gs.

params.name: protocol
params.description: The name of the protocol to unregister. Defaults to gs.

methods.name: signedUrlUploader
methods.description: Create an uploader to handle a Signed URL.

params.name: uri
params.description: The URI to accept an upload request.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be uploaded

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options. Refer to Google\Cloud\Core\Upload\AbstractUploader::__construct().

params.name: timestamp
params.description: The timestamp value.

params.name: nanoSeconds
params.description: The number of nanoseconds in the timestamp.

methods.name: getServiceAccount
methods.description: Get the service account email associated with this client.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.userProject
params.description: If set, this is the ID of the project which will be billed for the request.

methods.name: hmacKeys
methods.description: List Service Account HMAC keys in the project.

examples.caption: Get the HMAC keys associated with a Service Account email

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

params.name: options.serviceAccountEmail
params.description: If present, only keys for the given service account are returned.

params.name: options.showDeletedKeys
params.description: Whether or not to show keys in the DELETED state.

params.name: options.userProject
params.description: If set, this is the ID of the project which will be billed for the request.

params.name: options.projectId
params.description: The project ID to use, if different from that with which the client was created.

methods.name: hmacKey
methods.description: Lazily instantiate an HMAC Key instance using an Access ID.

params.name: accessId
params.description: The ID of the HMAC Key.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The project ID to use, if different from that with which the client was created.

params.name: metadata
params.description: HMAC key metadata.

methods.name: createHmacKey
methods.description:
Creates a new HMAC key for the specified service account.

Please note that the HMAC secret is only available at creation. Make sure to note the secret after creation.

params.name: serviceAccountEmail
params.description: Email address of the service account.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

params.name: options.userProject
params.description: If set, this is the ID of the project which will be billed for the request. NOTE: This option is currently ignored by Cloud Storage.

params.name: options.projectId
params.description: The project ID to use, if different from that with which the client was created.
